meanings.definition: Foolhardier: showing a reckless disregard for danger or consequences
meanings.sent1: The foolhardier decision to jump off the roof without checking for a soft landing led to a broken leg.
meanings.sent2: It was foolhardier to swim in the rough sea during a storm than to stay safely on the shore.
meanings.sent3: He always takes the foolhardier route, like trying to ride a bike with no hands down a steep hill.
meanings.sent4: Her foolhardier attitude towards handling fireworks made everyone nervous at the Fourth of July party.
meanings.sent5: The foolhardier stunt of trying to pet a wild bear ended predictably with a trip to the hospital.

meanings.definition: Foolhardier: more foolhardy than someone or something else
meanings.sent1: His foolhardier behavior made his friends worry more than usual about his safety.
meanings.sent2: The foolhardier adventurer always sought out riskier challenges than his companions.
meanings.sent3: Choosing the foolhardier path in the maze led to getting lost for hours before finding the exit.
meanings.sent4: The foolhardier competitor pushed himself harder than anyone else in the race, risking exhaustion.
meanings.sent5: She was always the foolhardier of the two siblings, willing to try things the other would never attempt.
